title: Why is the education system so poor in the United States but poor countries are well educated? - Quora
tags: Education in the United States of America

response.answer_text: You are, of course, correct  Ireland and Vietnam aren’t as rich as the United States, but their students do better. The United States ranks between Czech Republic and Latvia. And most of the other answers have hit on the biggest issue - local control over education, but then gloss over the bigger issue - this means rich localities have better education than poor localities. And sometimes, those localities are right next to each other in the United States. You will get a much better education in Grosse Point MI than Detroit. And that “local control” is deliberate and pretty much unique to the United States. And most of that “local control” deliberately and systematically pushes disadvantaged students into poorer schools. School districts are often deliberately drawn that way. Secondly though is the difference between “private” and “public” education. There is a lot of private education in the United States and the phenomenon is growing with the development of government funded “charters” which are a hybrid. The first charters were excellent, but that’s because they were rare. When every school tries to be a charter, the earlier ones tend to get the best staff. As a result, private resources often outcompete public ones, but that merely discourages citizens from properly funding the public schools. Compare with Finland, which used to be a country solidly in the yellow zone. It reformed its system by eliminating private schools, providing national funding for schools, and requiring better qualification for teachers. You need a Masters degree to teach high school in Finland. Teachers are also better paid. #9 South Korea has the highest teacher pay to average pay ratio in the developed world. Many teachers in the United States have to quit because pay is so low.  Yes, that’s right. Mexican teachers at the top pay scales make more than American ones.
